glsa.title: TigerVNC: Integer overflow
glsa.synopsis: An integer overflow in TigerVNC might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: TigerVNC is a high-performance VNC server/client.

description.p: TigerVNC is impacted by the same vulnerability as found in CVE-2014-6051. An integer overflow, leading to a heap-based buffer overflow, was found in the way screen sizes were handled.

impact.p: A remote attacker, utilizing a malicious VNC server, could execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the client, or cause a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
